data.title: The 60 Best NBA Houston Rockets Small Forwards
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 60 Best NBA Houston Rockets Small Forwards. Current Top 3: Tracy McGrady, Robert Horry, Trevor Ariza
data.text:
Ranked By

1.3K votes

259 voters

1 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Houston Rockets

Big fan of Houston basketball? Then check out this list of Houston Rockets small forwards. It includes almost every small forward from throughout Houston Rockets history, including current small forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA small forwards of all time, the best Rockets SFs include Rudy Tomjanovich, Robert Reid, Trevor Ariza, Shane Battier, and Tracy McGrady.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Houston Rockets starting SFs and backup SFs are Danuel House Jr. Garrison Mathews, and David Nwaba.

Who are the best small forwards in Houston Rockets history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Houston Rockets small forward of all time!

Most divisive: Buck Johnson

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 60 Best NBA Houston Rockets Small Forwards

Birthplace : USA, Florida, Bartow

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Atlanta Hawks

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Houston Rockets: 2004–2010

Starting his tenure with the Houston Rockets in 2004 after being traded from the Orlando Magic, Tracy McGrady was an unstoppable offensive force from the small forward position. Known for his smooth scoring ability and jaw-dropping athleticism, McGrady made a significant impact on the team throughout his time in Houston. The seven-time NBA All-Star and two-time scoring champion demonstrated incredible versatility and determination on both ends of the floor. Although never making it past the first round of the playoffs during his time with the Rockets, Tracy McGrady's individual accomplishments and captivating playstyle solidified his place among the best in team history.

Birthplace : Maryland, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Small forward, Power forward

Houston Rockets: 1992–1996

Known as "Big Shot Bob," Robert Horry joined the Houston Rockets in 1992 as their first-round draft pick and quickly became a crucial part of the team's success. A versatile defender and clutch three-point shooter, Horry played a key role in helping the Rockets secure back-to-back NBA championships in 1994 and 1995. His calm demeanor and knack for hitting game-winning shots in high-pressure situations left an indelible mark on team history. Despite not having extravagant individual accolades, Horry's invaluable contributions and a total of seven NBA championships throughout his career undoubtedly place him among the best small forwards in Rockets history.

Birthplace : Miami, Florida

Nationality : American

Team : New York Knicks

Position : Small forward

Houston Rockets: 2009–2010, 2014–2018

Signing with the Houston Rockets in 2009, Trevor Ariza quickly became an integral part of their core due to his tenacious defense and ability to hit three-pointers consistently. His versatility and dedication on both ends of the floor made him a reliable option on a roster that featured stars like James Harden and Dwight Howard. Ariza played critical minutes for the Rockets during their deep playoff runs, consistently proving his value as a lockdown defender and timely shooter. While lacking individual accolades, Trevor Ariza's grit and determination earned him a well-deserved spot among the best small forwards in the Houston Rockets' history.

Birthplace : Hamtramck, Detroit, Michigan

Nationality : United States of America

Team : San Diego Rockets, Houston Rockets

Position : Power forward

Houston Rockets: 1970–1981

Drafted by the Houston Rockets in 1970, Rudy Tomjanovich spent his entire NBA playing career with the team, making a name for himself as one of the most versatile and consistent small forwards in franchise history. Rudy T, as he was affectionately known, was a five-time NBA All-Star and played a pivotal role in helping the Rockets reach their first-ever NBA Finals appearance in 1981. His relentless work ethic and gritty style of play earned him the respect of teammates and opponents alike. Besides his success as a player, Tomjanovich also found great success as the Rockets head coach, winning back-to-back NBA championships in 1994 and 1995.

Birthplace : Raleigh, North Carolina

Nationality : American

Team : Toronto Raptors

Position : Small forward

Houston Rockets: 2017-2021

Signing with the Houston Rockets in 2017, P.J. Tucker instantly became an essential piece of the puzzle thanks to his relentless defense, toughness, and timely shooting from beyond the arc. His unwavering willingness to guard the opposing team's best player, battle for rebounds, and dive for loose balls endeared him to teammates and fans alike. As a key member of the Rockets team that reached the 2018 Western Conference Finals, Tucker's impact on winning was undeniable. Though he may lack individual accolades, P.J. Tucker's heart, hustle, and contributions to the Rockets franchise cement his place among the best small forwards in team history.

Birthplace : Birmingham, Michigan

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Miami Heat

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Houston Rockets: 2006–2011

Acquired by the Houston Rockets in a trade with the Memphis Grizzlies in 2006, Shane Battier immediately made an impact with his smothering defense and sharpshooting from beyond the arc. A consummate professional, Battier's intelligence and understanding of the game shone through in his ability to read opposing offenses and make crucial plays at just the right moment. Though never earning a championship with the Rockets, Shane Battier's selfless play and commitment to team success make him an unforgettable and integral part of the franchise's small forward lineage.
